Questions.Question: Who said 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do'?
Questions.Explanation: Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple Inc., emphasized the importance of passion in achieving greatness.

Questions.Question: Which leader said 'The best way to predict the future is to create it'?
Questions.Explanation: Peter Drucker, a renowned management consultant, believed in taking proactive steps to shape the future.

Questions.Question: Who said 'Leadership is not about being in charge. It is about taking care of those in your charge'?
Questions.Explanation: Simon Sinek, a motivational speaker, emphasized the responsibility of leaders to care for their team members.

Questions.Question: Which visionary said 'The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today'?
Questions.Explanation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States, encouraged overcoming doubts to achieve progress.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The function of leadership is to produce more leaders, not more followers'?
Questions.Explanation: Ralph Nader, an American political activist, believed in empowering others to become leaders.

Questions.Question: Which leader said 'The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things'?
Questions.Explanation: Ronald Reagan, the 40th President of the United States, emphasized the importance of character over achievements.

Questions.Question: Who said 'A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way'?
Questions.Explanation: John C. Maxwell, an author and speaker, defined a leader as someone who guides others by example.

Questions.Question: Which visionary said 'The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams'?
Questions.Explanation: Eleanor Roosevelt, a former First Lady of the United States, emphasized the power of believing in one's dreams.

Questions.Question: Who said 'Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality'?
Questions.Explanation: Warren Bennis, a pioneer in leadership studies, described leadership as the ability to turn vision into tangible results.

Questions.Question: Which leader said 'The art of leadership is saying no, not saying yes'?
Questions.Explanation: Tony Blair, the former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, highlighted the importance of setting boundaries as a leader.
